div.ab1: maḥalli ke avestā guyand aivanghan dar tag-e barsom bastan va avestā ḫvāndan
At the place where they recite the avestā, he has to tie the aivanghan at the bottom of the barsom and recite the following avestā
aivanghan bar miyān-e barsom be dasturi ke kosti bar miyān mi-bandand pičidan va barsom šemordan va barsom ke kučektar bāšad
He has to twist the aivanghan in the middle of the barsom in the same way as when they tie the kosti. He has to count the barsom and check which is the smaller (branch) of the barsom
be aṣ̌əm sar-aš boridan pe vōhū yeki digar yekǧou bolandtar ān boridan pe vahištəm bāqi ǧou bolandtar išān sar-aš boridan

At aṣ̌əm he has to cut the end (of the smallest branch). At vohū he has to cut another one one wheat corn longer. At vahištəm he has to cut the other some wheat corn longer (than the previous one)barsom.
pe š́iiaoθənanąm be-dasturi-ye kosti gereh afgandan
At š́iiaoθənanąm he has to make a knot like in the kosti.

nirang-e hum čidan be dastur-e barsom čidan wāǧ gereftan va be-hamān dastur čidan va se gere-ye hum avval ke ašem vohi čand dar miyān-e angošt negāh dārid va har čand ke ḫᵛāhand čidan va fe humdān kardan va be hamān šāḫ be-dastur-e barsom čidan va vāǧ be-goftan ān se gere-ye hum ham be fe humdān kardan va sar humdān moḥkam kardan va dast az humdān ǧodā kardan va vāǧ tamām be goftan

Instruction for cutting the hum in the same way as the barsom. He should take the wāz and should cut in the same way as the barsom , first, three twigs of hum that he held between his fingers while (reciting) as meany Aṣ̌əm Vohūs. As many more as he he wants to cut and put in the humdān, he should cut them from the same branche and in the same manner as the barsom and also take the wāz. He should also bring these three twigs to the humdān and finx them on the humdān and remove the hand from the and conclude the wāz

avval nirang urvarān čidan mašrabe-ye āb va fanām va kārd va barsom-čin piš-e deraḫt-e urvarān šodan wa fanām bastan xšnaoθra. ahurahe. mazdā̊. aṣ̌əm. vōhū. yek guftan va biḫ-e deraḫt-e urwarān pāk kardan va dast va kārd va biḫ-e urwarān b-āb-e pādyāvi pāk šostan

First, the instruction for cutting the urvarān. He should go to the tree of the urvarān (pomegranate) (bringing) a watter vessel, the padām, knife and the barsom-čin and bind the padām. He should recite xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ and one Aṣ̌əm Vohū. He should purify a branch (?) of the urvarān-tree and wash the hand, the knife and the branch of the urvarān with pādyāvi-water.
dovvom bār-e digar xšnaoθra. ahurahe. mazdā̊. ašəm. vohū. yek ḫᵛāndan dast va biḫ-e urvarān b-āb-e bādyāvi šostan
Second, he should recite another time xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ and one Aṣ̌əm Vohū and wash the hand and the branch of the urvarān with pādyāvi-water.
va seivom bār-e digar xšnaoθra. ahurahe. mazdā̊. aṣ̌əm. vōhū yek guftan va kārd va biḫ-e urwarān be-āb pādyāvi šostan
Third, he should recite another time xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ and one Aṣ̌əm Vohū and wash the knife and the branch of the urvarān with pādyāvi-water.

va aṣ̌əm guftan sar-e ān biḫ-e urwarān boridan vohū guftan wa kārd bar miyān-e ān nahādan vahištəm guftan ān biḫ-e urwarān boridan astī. uštā. astī. uštā. ahmāi hiiat̰. aṣ̌āi. vahištāi aṣ̌əm. urvarān čidan hič vāǧ gīrešni-ye digar nadārad wa urvarān pāre pāre kardan dar urvarāndān nahādan va dar yazešgāh bordan moḥkam kardan

He should say aṣ̌əm and cut the end of the urvarān-branch. He should say vohū and put the knife on the middle of it (the branch). He should say vahištəm and cut the urvarān-branch. During astī uštā astī uštā ahmāi hiiat̰ aṣ̌āi vahištāi , he should tear it off. There is no other wāz to take. He should cut in pieces the urvarān, put it on the urwarāndān, bring it to the yazešgāh and deposite it.
va yek aṣ̌əm vōhū goftan aɱāi. raēsca. tā sar va yek aṣ̌əm vōhū goftan hazaŋhrəm. se bār tā sar va yek ašem vohu goftan va jasa.mē. auuaŋhe. mazda. se bār tā sar va yek ašem vohu goftan

He should recite one Aṣ̌əm Vohū, (then) aɱāi raēsca until the end and one Aṣ̌əm Vohū, (followed by) three times hazaŋhrəm until the end. He should recite one Aṣ̌əm Vohū and three times jasa.mē auuaŋhe mazda until the end. He should recite one Aṣ̌əm Vohū.
nirang ǧām doḫtan naḫost gāv yā gusfand āvordan yā be galle-ye išān šodan va ǧāmdān rā se bār b-āb pādyāvi šostan va dast be gāv nahādan aṣ̌əm vohū se goftan

The instruction for milking the ǧām is, first, to bring a cow or a sheep or to go to a herd of these animals, to wash three tims the ǧāmdān with with pādyāb-water. He should put the hand on the cow, recite three Aṣ̌əm Vohūs
va dast be gāv nahādan aṣ̌əm vohū se goftan
He should put the hand on the cow, recite three Aṣ̌əm Vohūs

frauuarāne gāh ānče bid gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune tauua gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune xšnaoθra. y. v. x. f. yaϑā. ahū. vairiiō. zaotā. tā mraotū. agar do bid gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune yauuākəm gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune xšnaoθra. y. v. x. f. agar se bid yaϑā. ahū. vairiiō. zaotā. OD mraotū.

(He should recite three) the Frauuarāne with the corresponding gāh (with the šnūman) gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune tauua gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune xšnaoθra. y. v. x. f. and the wāz-gīrišnīh) from yaϑā ahū vairiiō zaotā until mraotū. If (the cows) are two, then gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune yauuākəm gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune xšnaoθra. y. v. x. f. . If (the cows) are three, then gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune yūšmākəm gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune xšnaoθra. y. v. x. f.. Then, (the wāz-gīrišnīh) yaϑā ahū vairiiō zaotā until mraotū.
avval se serešk u zamin duḫtan aša.sara. manaŋha miguyad šir u ǧāmdān midušad digar aṣ̌a.sara. vacaŋha miguyad šir u ǧāmdān midušad digar aṣ̌a.sara. š́iiaoθəna. miguyad ǧām andar ǧāmdān midušad

First, he should milk three drops on the earth while he says aša.sara manaŋha. He says further aṣ̌a.sara vacaŋha and milks milk into the ǧāmdān. He further says aṣ̌a.sara š́iiaoθəna and milks the ǰīwām into the ǰīwāmdān.

digar dast-e avar gāv nahāde yā gusfand va yaθā ahū vairiiō goftan va yasnəmca. tā sar āfrīnāmi gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune tauua gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune se tā har kodām be-vāǧ gerefte bāšand ān vāǧ beguyad pas andar yazešgāh bordan moḥkam nahādan pas durtar āyad yek aṣ̌əm vohū goftan ahmāi. raēsca. tās sar hazaŋhrəm. se bār tā sar jasa.mē. tā sar ašem vohu yek goftan

Further, he has to recite two Yaθā ahū vairiiō with the hand on the cow or the sheep and then yasnəmca until the end āfrīnāmi (with the šnūman) gə̄uš tašne gə̄uš urune tauua gə̄uš huδā̊ŋhō urune, one of the three ones -- they should say the vāǧ that they have taken (at the beginning). Then, he should bring it to the yazešngāh and place it. Then, he should go further and say one Aṣ̌əm Vohū and ahmāi raēsca until the end and three times hazaŋhrəm until the end. He should recite one Aṣ̌əm Vohū.

pas varas rā ke az gāv va varazā mičinand dast rā b-āb-e pādyāvi pāk bešuyad va ān varas rā be-dast girad se bār b-āb-e pādyāvi bešuyad xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā aṣ̌əm. vohū. se guftan frauuarāne gāh ānče bid ahurahe mazdā̊ raēuuatō xᵛarənaŋhato xšnaoθra OD frasastaiiaēca. yaϑā. ahū. vairiiō. zaotā. OD mraotū

Afterwards, they cut the varas from a cow or beef. He washes the hand clean with pādyāb and takes the varas with the hand and wash it three times with pādyāvi (and then recites) xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā, three Aṣ̌əm Vohūs and the Frauuarāne with the corresponding gāh (and the šnūman) ahurahe mazdā̊ raēuuatō xᵛarənaŋhato xšnaoθra until frasastaiiaēca and yaϑā ahū vairiiō zaotā until mraotū .

aṣ̌əm vōhū čahār guftan ke se ašem vohū az bon ō sar šostan va pas se bār ḥalqe begardānand pas yek ḥalqe-ye zarrin b-āb pādyāvi bešuyand va ān varas ḥalqe-karde dar gardan-e ān andazand va ān ḥalqe-ye zarrin rā be-sar-e barsom-čin konand va yek sukure porr az āb-e pādyāb konand va yek-pāre-ye var-e ātaš vaharām dar ānǧā konand yaʾni xākestar-e ātaš šeib-e-ān nahānd (quiere decir que colocan las cenizas en su base) čenānke ḫorm-e ātaš bālā na-yāyad va ān āb be-ǧuš āyad va panǧāh-o yek bār ān varas b-āb ǧušān foru barand va bar āvarand zud āb-e sard b-ānǧā foru rizand

He has to recite four Aṣ̌əm Vohū. During the third, he has to wash (the varas) from the begin to the end. They braid it three times and wash a golden ring with pādyāb. Then they put the braided varas in the the ring neck and pit the golden ring next to the barsom-čin. They fill a sukure with pādyāb and put some hot ashes of the Ātaš Vaharām in it (viz. the sukure), that is, they put ashes of the fire at its bottom so that the smoke of the fire does not go up and the water reaches the boiling point. The bring the varas fifty one times to the boiling water and take it out. Immediatly, the pour cold water on it.
digar ān varas az ḥalqe bāz konand se bār b-āb-e pādyāvi bešuyand
Then they lose again the varas from the ring and wash it three times with pādyāb.
čahār aṣ̌əm vōhū čon piš neveštam pas digar be-ḥalqe dar-ārand dar hamān ḥalqe-ye zarrin andazand va hezār-o-yek bār b-āb-e pādyāvi foru barand va bar-āvarand va varasdān nahand

four Aṣ̌əm Vohū as I have written before. Then they wind the varas in the ring and put it in the same golden ring. They bring it thousand and one times to the water and out of it and lay the varas-dān.

va yaθā ahū vairiiō do yasnəmca. tā ahurahe. mazdā̊. raēuuatō. xvarənaŋhatō. sar-aš mohkam be-nahand va dar yazišngāh mohkam be-nahand pas yek aṣ̌əm vohū ahmāi raēsca OD hazaŋhrəm. OD jasa.mē tamām ḫᵛāndan

Then they should recite two Yaθā ahū vairiiō and yasnəmca until (the šnūman ahurahe. mazdā̊. raēuuatō. xvarənaŋhatō. and they fix its end and they deposite it on the yazešngāh. Then he should recite one Aṣ̌əm Vohū, ahmāi raēšca until hazaŋhrəm and jasa.me. complete.

pas nirang farāhim-*zur gereftan pas zud va raṯvi dar yazišngāh šodan va ātaš dar *ādešt bar aforuḫtan va ān kasi ke zud bāšad har do fanān bastan va raṯvi dar pas sang-e urvis šodan va āb rā pādyāvi kardan va pādyāvi ān ast ke dar barsom čidan gufte budim ke se bār az ān mašrabe-ye bozorg dar mašrabe-ye ḫord rizand va az mašrabe-ye ḫord dar mašrabe-ye bozorg rizand va āb rā nik eḥtyaṭ konand ke pāk bāšad va pas ruy-e sang-e urvis rā *sukure se tā va ǧāmdān va him va pyāle va māhruy va hāvan va daste ān āb pāk šostan va har yek se bār pas zur bar gereftan ān ast ke *sukure-ye farāhimdān va *sukure-ye zurdān har do be-dast-e čab bar-dārand va āb-e pāk be-šostan va har yek se bār pādyāb karde be-dast-e rāst bar-dārand va az ruy-e sang-e urvis bālā dārand

Then, the instructions for the taking of the zur for the farāhim (= parāhum). Then, the zud and the raṯvi have to go to the yazišngāh and kindle the fire in the fire-stand. The one who is going to be the zud has to tie the two fanān and the raṯvi has to go to the other side of the urvisgāh and to make the water pure. This making pure of the water is what we have already described in the section about the cutting of the barsom (NerBarsomCidan1.5). He should pour three times water from the big vessel to the small vessel and from the small vessel to the big one. He should treat the water carefully so that it becomes pure. Afterwards he should wash with this water the three sukure, the ǧāmdān, the hum, the cup, the māhruy, the hāvan and the pestle on the urvisgāh, each one three times. Then, (it follws) the taking of the zur (zurgereftan). It consists of the follwing: He has to take with the left hand both, the sukure farāhimdān and the sukure zurdān, and wash them with pure water. Once each one has been cleaned three times, he should take them with the right hand and raise them from the stone of the urvis.

frā.tē. staōmaiδe. ahurāne. ahurahe. vaŋhīš. yasnąsca. vahmąsca. hubərətīsca. uštā.bərətīsca. vaṇta.bərətīsca. yazatanąm. ϑβā. aṣ̌aōnąm. kuxšnīša. āb andar sokure-ye do tā porr kardan us.mībarāma se bār sokure andar bālā va šib āvardan pas raϑβasca bərəzatō gāϑā̊sca srāuuaiiōit̰ sokure andar ruy-e sang-e urwis nahādan

frā.tē staōmaiδe ahurāne ahurahe +vaŋhūš yasnąsca vahmąsca hubərətīsca uštā.bərətīsca vaṇta.bərətīsca yazatanąm ϑβā aṣ̌aōnąm †kuxšnīša. He should fill the two cups with water. At †us.bībarāma he should move the cups up and down three times and then at raϑβasca bərəzatō gāϑā̊sca srāuuaiiōit̰ he should put them on the surface of the stone urwis.
pas yaϑā ahū vairiiō do goftan yasnəmca OD āfrīnāmi bərəzatō. ahurahe. nafəδrō. apąm. apasca. mazdaδātaiiā̊. va yek sokure-ye zarr az dast-e čab-e māhruy be-nahešn
Then, he should recite two Yaθā ahū vairiiō and yasnəmca until āfrīnāmi bərəzatō ahurahe nafəδrō apąm apasca mazdaδātaiiā and he sould place a golden cup to the left side of the māhruy .

pas digar haft šāḫ-e hum ke az gere tā gere yek-šāḫ ast pas xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ aṣ̌əm vōhū se guftan frauuarāne gāh ānče bid haomahe aṣ̌auua.zaŋhō xšnaoθra. y. v. x. f. yaϑā. ahū. vairiiō. zaotā. frā. mē. mrūtē. OD mraotū

Then, again the seven hum-twigs. (One twig) is what (goes) from one knot to another knot. Then (he should recite) xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ and three Aṣ̌əm Vohūs and the Frauuarāne with the corresponding gāh and (with the šnūman) haomahe aṣ̌auua.zaŋhō xšnaoθra. y. v. x. f. (and with the wāz-gīrišnīh) yaϑā. ahū. vairiiō. zaotā. frā. mē. mrūtē. until mraotū
ašem vohū se az sar u bon bešuyad pas u hum-†pālā nahešn
During three Aṣ̌əm Vohūs he washes (the seven hum-twigs) from top to botton and he raises (them).

yaθā ahū vairiiō do yasnəmca tā afrināmi haomahe aṣ̌auua.zaŋhō pas se šāh ō dast-e čab-e māhruy nahādan kenār-e zur čahār šāh andar hum-pāle gozāštan va digar panǧ pārre-ye urvarām stadan b-āb pādyāvi šostan va čahār pārre andar hum-pāle gozāštan va yek pārre andar dast-e čab māhruy nahādan kenār-e hum

(He should recite) two Yaθā ahū vairiiō, yasnəmca until āfrināmi (with the šnūman) haomahe aṣ̌auua.zaŋhō. Then, he should put three twigs to the left side of the mahruy, next to the zur and leave four twigs in the hum-pāle. Then he should take five pieces of urvarām, wash them with pādyāvi-water and leave four of them in the hum-pāle and one to the left side of the māhruy, next to the hum.

pas digar āb rā be-pādyāvi kardan be-dast šostan va barsom bist-o se tā be-aivyanghan gašte be-dast-e čab gereftan barsom-čin bā dast-e rāst gereftan pāk šostan va barsom-čin sar-e yek šāh-e barsom gereftan pas xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ aṣ̌əm vohū se frauuarāne gāh-e hāvan frasastaiiaēca ahurahe. mazdā̊. raēuuatō xvarənaŋvhatō xšnaoθra. y. v. x f. yaϑā. ahū. vairiiō. zaotā. OD mraotū

Then, he should purify the water and wash his hands. He should take the barsom tied with the aivyanghan with the left hand and the barsom-čin with the right. He should purify them and hold the barsom-čin on the end of a branch of the barsom. Then, he shoud recite xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ and three Aṣ̌əm Vohū and the Frauuarāne with the gāh hāvan (and the šnūman) ahurahe mazdā̊ raēuuatō xvarənaŋvhatō xšnaoθra. y. v. x f. (and the wāz-gīrišnīh) yaϑā ahū vairiiō zaotā until mraotū.
pas ān kasi ke barsom be-dast dārad do yaθā ahū vairiiō guftan
Afterwards, the one who holds the barsom in the hand has to recite two Ahuna Vairiia.
pas yek-yek barsom sar čidan va šemordan pas b-āb-e pādyāb šostan be-čahār ašem vohū se aṣ̌əm vohū az bon u sar šuyad va yek aṣ̌əm vōhū az sar u bon šuyad va barsom be pāy-e māhruy nahādan

AThen, he has to cut the end of the barsom, one to one, and count (the twigs) and wash them with pādyāb. (He has to recite) four Aṣ̌əm Vohūs. During the three first Aṣ̌əm Vohū, he washes them from the bottom to the top and during one Aṣ̌əm Vohū from the top to the bottom. He has to put the barsom at the bottom of the māhruy.

pas barsom andar miyān-e māhruy nahādan be-har do dast goftan xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ dahan barham nahādan be-wāǧ-e urmazd wa amešāsfandān beyāri ḫᵛāndan va setāyešn kardan dahan barham nahādan be-wāǧ-e urmazd wa amešāsfandān beyāri ḫᵛāndan va setāyešn kardan

Then he should put the barsom with both hand on the middle of the māhruy and recite xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊. He should close his mouth and recite in wāz the plea for Urmazd and Amešasfandān and praise then.

pas barsom andar miyān-e māhruy nahādan be-har do dast goftan xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ dahan barham nahādan be-wāǧ-e urmazd wa amešāsfandān beyāri ḫᵛāndan va setāyešn kardan dahan barham nahādan be-wāǧ-e urmazd wa amešāsfandān beyāri ḫᵛāndan va setāyešn kardan

Then he should put the barsom with both hand on the middle of the māhruy and recite xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊. He should close his mouth and recite in wāz the plea for Urmazd and Amešasfandān and praise then.

yaθā ahū vairiiō yek gere andar aivyanghan zadan va be š́iiaoθananąm gere saḫt kardan va be dovvom yaθā ahū vairiiō dovvom gere zadan š́iiaoθananąm saḫt kardan pas sar-e aivanghan bar barsom pičidan har do dast be-barsom māhruy moḥkam nahādan

At the (first) Ahuna Vairiia, he should tie a knot in the aivanghan and pull it tightly at š́iiaoθananąm. At the second Ahuna Vairiia, he has to tie a second knot and pull it tightly at š́iiaoθananąm. He should twist the end of the aivanghan in the barsom and fix it with both hands to the māhruy of the barsom.
va ānke ātaš afruzad yek ašəm vohū ḫᵛāndan nik barsom rā benegarand
The one who (/when he) kindles the fire, should recite one Aṣ̌əm Vohū and the look attentively at the barsom.
pas ān kasi ke barsom be-dast dārad do yaθā ahū vairiiō goftan yasnəmca tā āfrīnāmi. ahurahe. mazdā̊. raēuuatō xvarənaŋvhatō beguyad pas dast az barsom vāgirad

Then, the one who touches the barsom with the hand should recite two Yaθā ahū vairiiō and yasnəmca until āfrīnāmi (with the šnūman) ahurahe. mazdā̊ raēuuatō xvarənaŋvhatō and then he releases his hand from the barsom.

Then he should recite one Aṣ̌əm Vohū, one aɱāi raēšca until jasa.mē until the end. Then he shoud recite one Yaθā Ahū vairiiō. The one who will perform the yašt should go to the urvisgāh and recite the yašt until the end. He might use whatever šnūman he likes except the one for nu-nāvar or the visperad of the first day. Secondly, when he has completed the yašt, the zut should recite following avestā after having put the (remaining) farāhim: rātōiš darəgō.bāzāuš nāšū paitī.viiādā̊ paitī.sə̄ṇdā̊ mātarō jītaiiō. He should then recite a Yeŋ́hē.hātąm until the end. The one who will have performed the yašt, he should cut anew the varas, milk anew the ǧām, cut again the twenty-three twigs of the barsom. He should wash the varas according to the instructions for the first day, twist it in the ring, put it in its place. Next day he should complete the preparatives according to the instruction for the first day. He should take the farāhim, deposite it and when the yašt has been completed, he should pour the farāhim next day into a waterstream following the same instructions as for the first day. The one who will have performed the yašt, he shoud cut again anew the urvarān, cut the thirty-five twigs of the barsom, milk the ǧām, wash the varas according to the same instructions and twist it in the ring. He should immerse and take it out the water thousand and one times. Next day, he should dispose correctly all sāǧešn according to the same instructions of the first day. He should recite the farāhim and the setāyeš, put the farāhim at its place. Each time that they perform a yašt, they should get (new) farāhim, (pour) a drop into the farāhim-dān and put it on the hāvan as it is the custom. The farāhim is to that purpose. The yazešn (should be performed) with this farāhim ... (?), with pure clothes, pure sāǧešn, at a pure place, with a pure heart and with a correct recitation of the avestā according to the instructions. Might he obtain whatever he requires from the gods and the Amašāsfandān, whatever he requires from the gods. This is the instruction for getting the farāhim.
